summary: U.S. special operations forces personnel often need to know foreign languages to do their jobs overseas. The military services identify foreign languages for missions and how many personnel should know them. But planning officials couldn't explain how they align language needs with missions, and some of the identified needs may not be accurate or relevant. Also, many special operations forces members aren't meeting language proficiency...
title: Special Operations Forces: Enhanced Training, Analysis, and Monitoring Could Improve Foreign Language Proficiency
